tasks.title: Define storage types for integrations
tasks.description: Add TypeScript types for integration configurations and cached tool definitions to the core storage module.
steps: Add StorageIntegrationConfig interface to packages/core/src/storage/types.ts with fields: id, provider ('composio' | 'arcade'), name, enabled, selectedToolkits, metadata, ownerId, createdAt, updatedAt
Add StorageCachedTool interface with fields: id, integrationId, provider, toolkitSlug, toolSlug, name, description, inputSchema (JSON), outputSchema (JSON), rawDefinition (JSON), cachedAt, updatedAt
Add StorageListIntegrationsInput and StorageListIntegrationsOutput types following the agents pattern
Export all new types from packages/core/src/storage/types.ts
acceptanceCriteria: All types compile without errors
Types follow existing patterns in storage/types.ts
Types support the decided schema: toolkit selection with individual tool deselection

tasks.title: Create IntegrationsStorage abstract base class
tasks.description: Create the abstract storage domain class for integrations following the AgentsStorage pattern.
steps: Create base.ts with abstract IntegrationsStorage class extending StorageDomain
Define abstract methods: createIntegration, updateIntegration, deleteIntegration, getIntegrationById, listIntegrations
Define abstract methods for cached tools: cacheTool, cacheTools, getCachedTool, listCachedTools, deleteCachedToolsByIntegration, updateCachedToolsTimestamp
Add helper methods for parsing orderBy following AgentsStorage pattern
Create index.ts to export the domain
acceptanceCriteria: Abstract class compiles and follows AgentsStorage patterns
All CRUD operations for integrations are defined
All operations for cached tools are defined
Proper JSDoc documentation on all methods

tasks.title: Implement LibSQL IntegrationsStorage
tasks.description: Implement the IntegrationsStorage for LibSQL database with migrations.
steps: Add migration for 'integrations' table in stores/libsql/src/migrations/
Add migration for 'cached_tools' table in stores/libsql/src/migrations/
Implement all abstract methods from IntegrationsStorage
Add proper indexing on provider, integrationId, toolSlug columns
Register migrations in the LibSQL store initialization
acceptanceCriteria: Migrations create tables with correct schema
All CRUD operations work correctly
Integration tests pass for create/read/update/delete flows
Cached tools can be queried by integrationId

tasks.title: Implement in-memory IntegrationsStorage
tasks.description: Implement the in-memory storage adapter for integrations (used in tests and development).
steps: Use Map-based storage with deep cloning (follow InMemoryAgentsStorage pattern)
acceptanceCriteria: All CRUD operations work correctly in memory
Unit tests pass
Follows existing in-memory adapter patterns

tasks.title: Register integrations storage in Mastra bootstrap
tasks.description: Add integrations storage to the Mastra class and storage initialization.
steps: Update storage initialization in packages/core/src/storage/ to include integrations domain
Update Mastra constructor to accept and initialize integrations storage
Add getIntegrationsStorage() method or property to Mastra class
acceptanceCriteria: Mastra instance has access to integrations storage
Storage is properly initialized on startup
Existing tests continue to pass

tasks.title: Define ToolProvider interface
tasks.description: Create the abstraction layer interface for external tool providers.
steps: Define ProviderToolkit type: slug, name, description, icon, category, toolCount
Define ProviderTool type: slug, name, description, inputSchema, outputSchema, toolkit
Define ListToolkitsOptions: search, category, limit, cursor
Define ListToolsOptions: toolkitSlug, search, limit, cursor
Define ProviderStatus type: provider, connected, name, description, icon
acceptanceCriteria: Interface supports both Composio and Arcade API patterns
Types are generic enough for future providers
Pagination support via cursor/limit

tasks.title: Implement ComposioProvider
tasks.description: Implement the ToolProvider interface for Composio using their V3 API.
steps: Use fetch or existing @composio/core for API calls
Implement listTools() calling GET /api/v3/tools with toolkit_slug filter
Implement getProviderStatus() checking COMPOSIO_API_KEY env var
Map Composio response format to ProviderToolkit/ProviderTool types
Add error handling for API failures
acceptanceCriteria: Can list toolkits from Composio API
Can list tools filtered by toolkit
Can get individual tool details
Properly reports connection status based on API key presence
Handles API errors gracefully

tasks.title: Implement ArcadeProvider
tasks.description: Implement the ToolProvider interface for Arcade.dev.
steps: Implement listToolkits() - note: Arcade may not have explicit toolkits, may need to derive from tool names
Implement listTools() calling GET /v1/tools with toolkit filter
Implement getProviderStatus() checking ARCADE_API_KEY env var
Handle pagination (offset-based, convert to cursor pattern)
Map Arcade response format to ProviderToolkit/ProviderTool types
Add error handling for API failures
acceptanceCriteria: Can list tools from Arcade API
Can filter tools by toolkit/category
Can get individual tool details
Properly reports connection status based on API key presence
Handles API errors gracefully

tasks.title: Create provider registry and factory
tasks.description: Create a registry to manage and instantiate tool providers.
steps: Implement listProviders() returning all available providers with status
acceptanceCriteria: Can get provider instance by name
Can list all providers with their connection status
Providers are lazily instantiated

tasks.title: Create integration API schemas
tasks.description: Define Zod schemas for integration API request/response validation.
steps: Define listToolkitsQuerySchema (provider path param, search, category, pagination)
Define listToolsQuerySchema (provider path param, toolkit, search, pagination)
acceptanceCriteria: All schemas validate correct input/output
Schemas follow existing patterns in schemas/ directory
OpenAPI documentation annotations present

tasks.title: Implement integration API handlers
tasks.description: Create handlers for integration CRUD and provider proxy endpoints.
steps: Implement CREATE_INTEGRATION_ROUTE handler - also caches selected tools
Implement DELETE_INTEGRATION_ROUTE handler - also deletes cached tools
Implement GET_PROVIDERS_ROUTE handler - returns provider list with connection status
Implement LIST_PROVIDER_TOOLKITS_ROUTE handler - proxies to provider API
Implement LIST_PROVIDER_TOOLS_ROUTE handler - proxies to provider API
Implement REFRESH_INTEGRATION_TOOLS_ROUTE handler - re-fetches and updates cached tools
acceptanceCriteria: All CRUD operations work correctly
Provider proxy endpoints forward requests to external APIs
Proper error handling and status codes
Tool caching occurs on create/refresh

tasks.title: Register integration routes
tasks.description: Add integration routes to the server adapter.
steps: Export INTEGRATIONS_ROUTES array with all integration route handlers
Add INTEGRATIONS_ROUTES to main routes index in packages/server/src/server/server-adapter/routes/index.ts
Ensure routes are registered in server adapter initialization
acceptanceCriteria: All integration endpoints accessible via API
Routes follow existing naming conventions
OpenAPI spec includes new endpoints

tasks.title: Add integration methods to MastraClient SDK
tasks.description: Extend the JavaScript client SDK with methods for integration management.
acceptanceCriteria: All integration API endpoints have corresponding client methods
TypeScript types are correct
Methods handle errors appropriately

tasks.title: Integrate cached tools with tool resolution
tasks.description: Extend agent tool resolution to include tools from stored integrations.
steps: Add 'integrations' field to StorageAgentType (array of integration IDs)
Update stored agent schema to include integrations field
Modify agent's convertTools() or tool resolution flow to call resolveIntegrationTools()
Convert cached tool definitions to ToolAction format
Handle tool execution by proxying to provider API or using provider SDK
acceptanceCriteria: Agents can reference integrations by ID
Tools from referenced integrations are available to the agent
Tool execution works correctly through provider

tasks.title: Add tool execution proxy for integration tools
tasks.description: Implement the execution layer that calls external provider APIs when integration tools are invoked.
steps: Implement executeComposioTool() using Composio's execute endpoint
Implement executeArcadeTool() using Arcade's execute endpoint
Create wrapper that converts ToolAction execute() to provider API call
Handle authentication headers (API keys from env)
Handle response mapping back to Mastra format
acceptanceCriteria: Integration tools can be executed through their provider APIs
Execution results are properly formatted
Errors from providers are handled gracefully

tasks.title: Create integration provider hooks
tasks.description: Add React Query hooks for fetching provider and integration data.
steps: Create hooks/use-provider-tools.ts with useProviderTools(provider, toolkit) hook
Create types.ts for UI-specific integration types
Export all hooks from domain index
acceptanceCriteria: All hooks properly fetch from MastraClient
Loading and error states are handled
Data is properly typed

tasks.title: Create provider list component
tasks.description: Build the component that displays available integration providers with connection status.
steps: Disable click on unconnected providers with tooltip explaining missing ENV var
Add onClick handler to select provider
acceptanceCriteria: Shows all providers (Composio, Arcade)
Clearly indicates which are connected
Unconnected providers show helpful message about ENV var

tasks.title: Create toolkit browser component
tasks.description: Build the component for browsing and selecting toolkits from a provider.
steps: Display toolkit cards with name, description, icon, tool count
Add category filter if provider supports it
acceptanceCriteria: Can browse all toolkits from a provider
Search filters toolkits by name
Can select/deselect toolkits
Handles loading and empty states

tasks.title: Create tool selector component
tasks.description: Build the component for viewing and deselecting individual tools within selected toolkits.
steps: Fetch tools using useProviderTools hook for selected toolkits
Display tool list grouped by toolkit
Show tool name, description, input schema preview
acceptanceCriteria: Shows all tools from selected toolkits
All tools selected by default
Can deselect individual tools
Shows helpful tool information

tasks.title: Create Add Tools dialog
tasks.description: Build the main dialog component that orchestrates the add tools flow.
steps: Multi-step wizard: 1) Select Provider, 2) Select Toolkits, 3) Review/Deselect Tools, 4) Confirm
Track wizard state (current step, selected provider, selected toolkits, deselected tools)
On confirm: call createIntegration mutation with selected data
acceptanceCriteria: Full flow works: provider -> toolkits -> tools -> save
Can navigate back and forth between steps
Saves integration with cached tools
Handles errors gracefully

tasks.title: Add 'Add Tools' button to Tools page
tasks.description: Integrate the Add Tools dialog into the existing Tools page.
steps: Add 'Add Tools' button to HeaderAction section
Invalidate tools query on successful addition
acceptanceCriteria: 'Add Tools' button visible on Tools page
Clicking opens the Add Tools dialog
After adding tools, Tools page refreshes

tasks.title: Display integration tools in Tools table
tasks.description: Update the Tools page to show tools from stored integrations alongside code-defined tools.
steps: Update useTools hook or create useAllTools to include integration tools
Fetch integrations and their cached tools
Merge integration tools with code-defined tools
Add 'source' indicator to tool table (code vs integration name)
Handle tool detail page for integration tools
acceptanceCriteria: Integration tools appear in Tools table
Can distinguish integration tools from code tools
Tool count includes integration tools

tasks.title: Add integrations management page
tasks.description: Create a page to view and manage configured integrations.
steps: List all configured integrations with provider, toolkit count, tool count
Show last synced timestamp for each integration
Add 'Refresh' button to re-sync tools from provider
acceptanceCriteria: Can view all configured integrations
Can refresh tools for an integration
Can delete an integration
Shows helpful metadata

tasks.title: Add integration selector to agent form
tasks.description: Allow users to assign integrations to agents when creating/editing.
steps: Fetch available integrations using useIntegrations hook
acceptanceCriteria: Can select integrations when creating agent
Can update integrations when editing agent
Selected integrations are saved with agent

tasks.title: Add integration tests for integration storage
tasks.description: Write integration tests for the integrations storage layer.
steps: Test edge cases: duplicate IDs, missing integrations, etc.
acceptanceCriteria: All storage operations have test coverage
Tests pass with LibSQL adapter
Edge cases are covered

tasks.title: Add integration tests for provider APIs
tasks.description: Write tests for the provider abstraction layer.
acceptanceCriteria: Provider methods have test coverage
API response mapping is tested
Error scenarios are covered

tasks.title: Add E2E tests for integration flow
tasks.description: Write end-to-end tests for the complete add tools flow.
steps: Create E2E test file for integration flow
Test: tools appear in Tools page
acceptanceCriteria: Full user flow is tested
Tests pass in CI
Key user interactions are verified

tasks.title: Document integration feature
tasks.description: Add documentation for the dynamic tool integrations feature.
steps: Add docs page explaining the feature
Add screenshots of the UI flow
Document how integration tools work with agents
Add API reference for integration endpoints
